heisigComment: * As a primitive, this character has two forms. Reduced to the left side only, it can mean a column, going, or a line of something or other. When the middle is opened up to make room for other elements, it means a boulevard.
heisigStory: By joining the top four strokes, you should get a picture of the front current of a river, the stream trailing behind. Hence the character for going.
koohiiStory1: I use The Flash for for this primitive; a superhero who is always going very fast.
koohiiStory2: To me, this looks like a bridge going over a body of water, being supported by columns underneath it. Being that I live near the ocean, I see tourists and vacationers coming and going constantly on the bridge. Because the bridge is so long, it forms an arc to support the structural integrity. You can see that arc here.
kunYomi: い.く、ゆ.く、-ゆ.き、-ゆき、-い.き、-いき、おこな.う、おこ.なう
readingExamples: 行進 (こうしん), 行為 (こうい), 旅行 (りょこう), 行列 (ぎょうれつ), 行政 (ぎょうせい), 修行 (しゅぎょう), 行く (い.く), 行う (おこな.う), 行く (ゆ.く)
words: misunderstanding, estrangement, disagreement, crossing without meeting, going astray
to perform, to do, to conduct oneself, to carry out
doing (with resolve), carrying out (i.e. a plan)
pursuit of knowledge, studying, learning, training, ascetic practice, discipline
running a wheeled vehicle (e.g. car), traveling
(going) side by side, concurrent, abreast, at the same time, occurring together, parallel, parallelism
walking around at night, night train, night travel
flourish, thrive, be popular, come into fashion
(going) side by side, concurrent, abreast, at the same time, occurring together, parallel, parallelism
walking around at night, night train, night travel
